# Basic concepts {#concepts}


## Prevalence

Relative prevalences (population frequencies) at a 1% compositional abundance threshold:

```{r concepts_prevalence, warning=FALSE, message=FALSE, eval=FALSE}
library(mia)
data(enterotype)
me <- enterotype # Rename data for generic examples
head(mia::prevalence(me, detection = 1/100, sort = TRUE))
```


Absolute population prevalences (sample count):

```{r concepts_prevalence2, eval=FALSE}
head(mia::prevalence(me, detection = 1/100, sort = TRUE, count = TRUE))
```


## Prevalent microbiota analysis

If you only need the names of the prevalnt taxa, do as follows. This
returns the taxa that exceed the given prevalence and detection
thresholds.

```{r core-members, message=FALSE, warning=FALSE, eval = FALSE}
prev <- mia::prevalentMembers(me, detection = 0, prevalence = 50/100)
```

See also related functions for the analysis of rare and variable taxa (rareMembers; rareAbundance; lowAbundance).
